subject: Re: [junit] Re: Any plans to revamp junit?
msgSnippet: ... Sorry, your objection seems to be flawed logically. You might be serious and use your own test runner. This does not preclude your also using the basic
messageBody:
> > Is there any reason to use the official JUnit
> > distribution for its testcase runner(s) vs just
> its
> > TestCase interface? I hear all serious people have
> > their own runners anyway.
>
> Rudeness objection. I use the basic test runners and
> I am /quite/ serious.

Sorry, your objection seems to be flawed logically.
You might be serious and use your own test runner.
This does not preclude your also using the basic test
runners.

The fact that there is apparent need for better test
runners, that basic runners are not used by all IDEs
or ANT makes my question legitimate, I think.

JUnit is the de facto standard, but it's the TestCase
interface, not anything else. Or am I mistaken?
